knimeNode.name: Function Fitting
knimeNode.shortDescription: Fits data to a simple scalar function.

fullDescription.intro: Fits data to a simple scalar function.
fullDescription.option: When enabled regression with the independent variable subject to the specified detection limit is performed (NIE, Lei, et al. Linear regression with an independent variable subject to a detection limit. Epidemiology (Cambridge, Mass.), 2010, 21. Jg., Nr. Suppl 4, S. S17).
When checked, all the following options can be set/changed. Otherwise default parameters are used.

option.name: Maximum Evaluations to Find Start Values

fullDescription.option: Before the optimization algorithm is executed, multiple combinations of start values are evaluated to find the combinations with the lowest errors. This option specifies the maximum number of start value combinations, that are evaluated evaluated.
The optimization algorithm is executed with start value combinations, that have the lowest errors. This option specifies the maximum of start value combinations, with which the algorithm is executed.
If checked, the first successful result of the optimization algorithm is used as the result of this node and the execution is stopped. Otherwise the execution continues to find better results.

option.name: Maximum Iterations in each run of Optimization Algorithm

fullDescription.option: This option specifies the maximum of iterations of the optimization algorithm for each start value combination.

option.name: Specific Start Values for Fitting Procedure

fullDescription.option: Here the user can specify boundaries for the start value of each parameter.
If checked, the optimization algorithm only return results, where the parameter values are in the specified boundaries.

ports.inPort: Simple scalar function, that is fitted to the data.
Data, to which the function is fitted.
ports.outPort: Parameter value and some quality measures.
